reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Nepal Development Programme aims at improving food insecurity, sustainable livelihoods and gender equality as well as decease caste/ethnicity-based discriminations, mitigate disaster and climate change impacts and empower towards enforcement of human right s as well as participation in decision-making at local and national context. Programme covers 30 Village Development Committees (VDCs). Expected results:? Enhanced capacity of disadvantaged communities to reduce disaster risk and to prepare for, respond to and, when necessary recover from emergencies and disasters.? Increased income and food security attained by all members within disadvantaged households.? Increased capacity of cooperatives in enhancing the sustainable livelihoods of their membership, with particular focus on the poorer segments.? Increased participation, voice and influence of priority populations in local institutions and decision-making processes. Rights-holders /beneficiaries: Marginalised, vulnerable and conflict-affected people such a s Dalit, freed bonded labourers, disaster affected population, ethnic minorities, landless, women-headed households and childrenImplementing partner: The Lutheran World Federation Nepal (LWF Nepal).
